example.eg: We may have to take a later flight.
example.egtrans: 我们也许得坐晚一点的班机。

example.eg: I may be able to go to the beach this week.
example.egtrans: 也许我本周能去海边呢。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 也许，可能，有可能，有希望

example.eg: Yes, you may call me by my first name.

dsense.name: may
dsense.guideword: (request: 1st person) (情态动词，表示请求，第一人称单数)

example.eg: May I have a drink, please?
May your children always be healthy and happy.
She may well be your best friend, but she doesn't have the right to speak to you like that.
The girl chosen to be May Queen wore a white dress and was crowned with may.
The may in our back garden is in blossom.
My cousin was born in May.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看情形而定，视情况而定

example.eg: The weather forecast says there will be heavy rain tomorrow. Be that as it may, we will not cancel the open-air concert.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 尽管如此, 即便如此

example.eg: I'll remain happy come what may.

dsense.name: devil-may-care
dsense.guideword: informal (person, approach: reckless) (非正式用语，人)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 肆无忌惮的, 无所顾忌的, 不顾一切的

example.eg: It may be that the weather will improve tomorrow.

dsense.name: let the chips fall where they may

example.eg: I'm going to tell the boss the truth; let the chips fall where they may.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不顾后果, 无论后果如何, 愿最佳者胜出, 望胜者实至名归

example.eg: They may well win the tournament.

dsense.name: might as well, may as well

example.eg: I might as well go with you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最好, 不妨, 莫如

dsense.name: might as well, may as well

example.eg: It might as well be winter, with all this cold wet weather we're having.
example.egtrans: 我们这儿一天天的湿冷天气，就像身处冬季一般。

dsense.name: To whom it may concern
dsense.guideword: formal, written (salutation in a letter) (信件)

example.eg: To whom it may concern, I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with my recent visit to your restaurant.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 敬启者, 致有关人士，给有关人士
